# ProcessInfo.ThermalState

**Enumeration**

Values used to indicate the system’s thermal state.

## Declaration

```swift
enum ThermalState
```

## Overview

These values are used by the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/ProcessInfo] class as return values for [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/ProcessInfo/thermalState-swift.property].

For information about testing your app under different thermal states, see [https://help.apple.com/xcode/mac/current/#/dev308429d42].

## Constants

- **ProcessInfo.ThermalState.nominal**: The thermal state is within normal limits.
- **ProcessInfo.ThermalState.fair**: The thermal state is slightly elevated.
- **ProcessInfo.ThermalState.serious**: The thermal state is high.
- **ProcessInfo.ThermalState.critical**: The thermal state is significantly impacting the performance of the system and the device needs to cool down.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Getting the Thermal State

- **thermalState**: The current thermal state of the system.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
